instructions: Dalsan M April 28, 2014 at 10:50 am If neither of the above suggestions work for you, you can use the guide and files found at XDA Developers (a special thread was created due to similar issues). http://forum.xda-developers.com/xperia-l/help/solved-xperia-l-drivers-adb-problems-t2493042 Hovsep A April 26, 2014 at 4:43 pm PC Companion http://www.sonymobile.com/au/tools/pc-companion/ Oron J April 26, 2014 at 4:33 pm Open the Device Manager on your PC (if you're not familiar with it, right-click on "(My) Computer" and choose "Manage", then click "Device Manager" on the left). Now plug in your phone and wait a few seconds. A device will be listed which will have an exclamation mark or an X over it. Right-click on it and uninstall it. Disconnect the phone, wait a few seconds and plug it in again. It should be recognised and hopefully a fresh copy of the driver will be installed.
